bibl.title: Notes on the Armenians and the Coptic Heritage.

Coptic Society, Literature and Religion from Late Antiquity to Modern Times. Proceedings of the Tenth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Rome, September 17th-22nd, 2012 and Plenary Reports of the Ninth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Cairo, September 15th-19th, 2008. I; - II

bibl.note: Short history of the Armenian community in Egypt. - Examples of Armenian influence in the Coptic and Armenian churches: a. Paintings and the Armenian Cross in Coptic Monastic Churches; - b. Armenian Inscriptions and Graffiti in Coptic Monastic Churches. - The White Monastery in Sohag, Upper Egypt. - The Church of St. Anthony near the Red Sea, the Deesis chapel. - The Monastery of al-Baramus in Wadi al-Natrun. - The Monastery of al-Surian in Wadi al-Natrun [includes a Coptic graffiti]. - The Armenian Monastery in Wadi al-Natrun. - Yuhanna al-Armani (Hanna or Hanna Karabed al-Armany), painter of Coptic icons (1742-1783 AD).
bibl.seg: Mary Kupelian, Notes on the Armenians and the Coptic Heritage.

Paola Buzi, Alberto Camplani & Federico Contardi (edd.), Coptic Society, Literature and Religion from Late Antiquity to Modern Times. Proceedings of the Tenth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Rome, September 17th-22nd, 2012 and Plenary Reports of the Ninth International Congress of Coptic Studies, Cairo, September 15th-19th, 2008. II = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 247 (Leuven - Paris - Bristol, CT, 2016) pp. 1623-1639, 9 figg.

Short history of the Armenian community in Egypt. - Examples of Armenian influence in the Coptic and Armenian churches: a. Paintings and the Armenian Cross in Coptic Monastic Churches; - b. Armenian Inscriptions and Graffiti in Coptic Monastic Churches. - The White Monastery in Sohag, Upper Egypt. - The Church of St. Anthony near the Red Sea, the Deesis chapel. - The Monastery of al-Baramus in Wadi al-Natrun. - The Monastery of al-Surian in Wadi al-Natrun [includes a Coptic graffiti]. - The Armenian Monastery in Wadi al-Natrun. - Yuhanna al-Armani (Hanna or Hanna Karabed al-Armany), painter of Coptic icons (1742-1783 AD).
